original: Bergström, Yngve Albert, civilingenjör, besiktningsman f. motorfordon, Göteborg, f. 22/5/98 i Gårdeby, Östergötl. 1., av dir. Albert B. o. An-toinette Lundberg. G. 26 m. Elsie Wallin. Barn: Marianne L 29, Ulla-Brit 34. — Stud:ex. v. Östermalms lärov. i Sthlm 17, avg:ex. fr. KTH (S) 22. Anst. v. Trafik A-B i Sthlm motoravd., v. flottans flygv. i Sthlm, v. Norrahammars Bruk, reklamchef v. Atlas Diesel i Sthlm, priv. körsk. i Sthlm, besiktn:man f. motorfordon i Kronob. 1. 26-40, i Gbgs o. Boh. 1. sed. 41. Led. av Sv. tekn:fören. sed. 23 o. av KAK sed. 29. Hobbies: målning, skulptur, pistolskjutn., seghng.
translated: Bergström, Yngve Albert, engineer, vehicle inspector for motor vehicles, from Gothenburg, born May 22, 1898 in Gårdeby, Östergötland, Sweden. Son of director Albert B. and Antoinette Lundberg. Married to Elsie Wallin in 1926, and has two children: Marianne L born in 1929 and Ulla-Brit born in 1934. Completed high school at Östermalms lärov. in Stockholm in 1917 and graduated from KTH (Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm) in 1922. Worked at Trafik A-B in Stockholm, motor department, at the navy aviation in Stockholm, at Norrahammars Bruk, as an advertising manager at Atlas Diesel in Stockholm, as a private driving instructor in Stockholm, and as a vehicle inspector for motor vehicles in Kronoberg County from 1926-1940, and in Gothenburg and Bohus County since 1941. He has been a member of the Swedish Society of Engineering since 1923 and the Royal Automobile Club (KAK) since 1929. Hobbies include painting, sculpture, shooting, and sailing.
